attributes.description: Specifies the type of fuel that can be used by the system. Supports conventional Jet-A1 and certified biofuel blends for optimized engine performance.
attributes.name: fuelType

attributes.description: Indicates the maximum fuel capacity stored in the reinforced fuel cells, ensuring sufficient supply under extended flight and reserve conditions.
attributes.name: tankCapacity

attributes.description: Defines the fuel pump's operational flow rate required for rapid engine responsiveness and optimal fuel management.
attributes.name: pumpFlowRate

attributes.description: Specifies the operating pressure range maintained by the fuel pump assembly, ensuring stable fuel delivery during all flight phases.
attributes.name: pumpPressure

attributes.description: Describes the particulate filtration efficiency to guarantee that only clean fuel reaches the engine, significantly minimizing wear and risk of contamination.
attributes.name: filterPerformance

attributes.description: Indicates the redundancy level incorporated in critical fuel system components to enhance reliability and safety during flight operations.
attributes.name: systemRedundancy

designScenario.description: The Advanced Fuel System is engineered for modern passenger airplanes, integrating state-of-the-art fuel storage, pump mechanisms, and control modules. This system is designed to ensure precise fuel management, optimized performance during varying flight conditions, and enhanced safety measures via redundant designs and advanced monitoring. The system is built to integrate seamlessly with other airplane subsystems while complying with rigorous aviation standards.
designScenario.name: Advanced Fuel System

details.description: The system shall accurately control fuel delivery to meet engine demands across phases such as takeoff, cruise, and landing.
The fuel pump assembly must deliver fuel at a consistent pressure of 3-6 Bar with a flow rate of 500 liters/min to support rapid engine response and efficiency.
Integrate advanced safety features including leak detection sensors, emergency shutdown valves, and redundant pumping systems to mitigate fuel-related hazards.
The design must emphasize ease of maintenance and high reliability, featuring modular components that allow for rapid in-field replacement and periodic inspection cycles.

relationships.description: The Fuel Pump Assembly depends on the Fuel Storage Cell to maintain a consistent supply of fuel; any disruption in storage will affect pump performance.
The Fuel Distribution Controller is associated with the Fuel Pump Assembly to regulate the routing of fuel based on engine demands and sensor feedback.
The Fuel Filter Element is composed within the Fuel Distribution Controller, ensuring only clean fuel is delivered to the engines.
The Sensor Array aggregates real-time data from both the Fuel Storage Cell and Fuel Pump Assembly to monitor fuel quality, pressure, and temperature.
The Sensor Array also provides monitoring information to the Fuel Distribution Controller to facilitate dynamic fuel routing adjustments during flight.

systemComponents.description: A reinforced tank designed to safely store fuel under varying atmospheric and flight conditions, equipped with internal systems to monitor pressure and fuel integrity.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Storage Cell

subComponents.description: A protective lining system to prevent contamination and chemical interactions which may compromise fuel quality.
subComponents.name: Reinforced Tank Lining

subComponents.description: An integrated pressure gauge providing real-time monitoring of internal tank conditions.
subComponents.name: Internal Pressure Gauge

systemComponents.description: A high-performance assembly responsible for pumping fuel from storage to the control modules and ultimately to the engines.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Pump Assembly

subComponents.description: A hydraulic booster designed for efficient fuel transfer during high-demand flight maneuvers.
subComponents.name: Hydraulic Booster

subComponents.description: An electronic control module that regulates pump operation based on dynamic sensor inputs.
subComponents.name: Electronic Control Module

systemComponents.description: An intelligent module that directs the distribution of fuel, coordinating valve operations and integrating sensor data for optimal fuel routing.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Distribution Controller

subComponents.description: A valve control unit ensuring precise operation of distribution valves based on system commands.
subComponents.name: Valve Control Unit

subComponents.description: A backup manual valve that can be activated in emergencies to override automatic controls.
subComponents.name: Backup Manual Valve

systemComponents.description: A dedicated filtration component ensuring that fuel is free from particulate contaminants before reaching engine systems.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Filter Element

systemComponents.description: A network of sensors distributed throughout the system to continuously monitor fuel parameters, contributing data to maintain optimal system performance.
systemComponents.name: Sensor Array

subComponents.description: A sensor that measures fuel levels within storage, providing real-time data for fuel management.
subComponents.name: Fuel Level Measurement Sensor

subComponents.description: A sensor dedicated to monitoring fuel pressure across the system, ensuring stability during dynamic operations.
subComponents.name: Pressure Monitoring Sensor

subComponents.description: A specialized unit for tracking fuel temperature, critical in preventing thermal degradation during extended flights.
subComponents.name: Temperature Sensing Unit

requirements.name: Structural Integrity Requirement
requirements.text: The tank must safely contain fuel under extreme temperatures and high pressure to preserve fuel quality.

requirements.name: Capacity Requirement
requirements.text: The fuel capacity shall be 3000 liters.

requirements.name: Operating Pressure Requirement
requirements.text: The safe operating pressure range shall be up to 5 Bar.

requirements.name: Sensor Redundancy Requirement
requirements.text: The system shall feature dual redundant sensor integration for monitoring and control.

rag_context: The Fuel Storage Tank subsystem is a critical component in the aircraft's fuel system. It is engineered to safely contain and preserve fuel quality under diverse environmental conditions, including extreme temperatures and high pressure. Designed with aerospace-grade materials and advanced composite liners, the tank ensures minimal contamination and structural integrity throughout its operational life. The design supports integrated sensor monitoring and compatibility with upstream fuel pumps and downstream distribution systems. The tank has a fuel capacity of 3000 liters and a safe operating pressure range of up to 5 Bar. It also features dual redundant sensor integration for monitoring and control interfaces.
